posts._title: Yasujirô Ozu – Shukujo wa nani o wasureta ka AKA What Did the Lady Forget? (1937)
posts.title: Shukujo wa nani o wasureta ka
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:An affluent medical professor, Komiya, and his bossy wife, Tokio, are to look after Setsuko, their high-spirited niece from Osaka. Setsuko is a liberated woman who does what she wants, including smoking, even though she is a minor. On Saturday, the professor does not feel like going to his weekend golf game, but his wife …

posts._title: Jean-Jacques Annaud – La guerre du feu AKA Quest for Fire (1981)
posts.title: La guerre du feu
posts.excerpt: Quote:“Fire was a symbol of power and a means of survival. The tribe who possessed fire, possessed life.” – Opening title card That is the last piece of modern language iterated by the film. The filmmakers transport us 80,000 years into the past, to the Middle Palaeolithic era. The subsequent complex creation of communication was …

posts._title: Kevin Connor & Douglas Hickox – Mistral’s Daughter (1984)
posts.title: Mistral’s Daughter
posts.excerpt: An arrogant Paris painter attracts a number of women from the 1920s to the 1970s, though he focuses on leaving a legacy for his daughter.

posts.title: Hakkodasan

posts._title: Eric Baudelaire – Also Known As Jihadi (2017)
posts.title: Also Known As Jihadi
posts.excerpt: The path to radicalism of a young man from France to Syria, and back to France, where he is incarcerated for allegedly joining Daesh, is rendered purely through a series of landscape shots filmed at the locations traversed by the subject.

posts._title: Ulrich Seidl – Mit Verlust ist zu rechnen AKA Loss Is to Be Expected (1992)
posts.title: Mit Verlust ist zu rechnen
posts.excerpt: Quote:In a small Austrian village near the Czech border lives Sepp Paur, a widower. The food supply that his late wife stored in the freezer is running low. It is time for Sepp to look for another wife. He looks across the border, where the widow Paula lives. Two people, two neighboring villages. In between? …

posts.title: Monos
posts.excerpt: Anarchy clashes with adolescence as a squadron of teen rebels on a remote mountaintop watch over a prisoner amid drills, attacks and misdeeds.

posts.title: The Dam Busters
posts.excerpt: The story of the conception of a new British weapon for smashing the German dams in the Ruhr industrial complex and the execution of the raid by 617 Squadron ‘The Dam Busters’.

posts._title: Jee-woon Kim – Janghwa, Hongryeon AKA A Tale of Two Sisters (2003)
posts.title: Janghwa, Hongryeon
posts.excerpt: Quote:A dark old house that holds its secrets close. Two sisters tormented by an evil stepmother and clinging to one another for comfort while their aloof, ineffectual father hides in his work and tries to ignore the mounting tension in his household. The onset of puberty, the first spilling of menstrual blood, is marked by …
